newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices up, state firms resume buying.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices up, state firms resume buying.

text.p: Indian cotton prices gained on resumed buying by state agencies while new crop arrivals were lower then expected, dealers said.
They said farmers were bringing limited quantities into the market following price-falls last week.

In spot deals Bengal desi (ready delivery) rose by 50-60 rupees to 970-1,010 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned rose by 10-20 rupees to 1,635-1,710. Gujarat Sankar-4 (long stapled variety) gained by 200 rupees to 20,500-21,200 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
